column5: Hey everyone,  The grandparents are in Arizona and are coming back in the next week or so. The place they are staying at is right around the corner from cabelas. Well there particular cabelas has Terminator T-2 spinners on sale for $2 ..... I want to see what colors they have but I cant seem to find the T-2 on the cabelas site or the BPS site. Only the T-1  Can anyone tell me the difference betweeen the two ?  Im thinking I need black, Chartreuse, and white...  Thanks  PS they also have powerbaits on for $.99 !!! thats a pretty fancy deal I think !
hahah good call !!!! im an idiot ! haha
lol no your not!  My wife can give you about 3000 reasons why i am though  cheers!
http://cabelasflyers.dirxion.com/1se/glend...WebProject.asp#  Take a look at some of the deals... well deals to me ? haha  the Shimano Sahara reel combo on the first page looks pretty appealing ?

hey you are probally close enough to due a day trip over to michigan to the cabelas there???  I think its in dundee?  not sure how far from the border that is though.  I have never used terminator baits before but have heard some really good things about the quality.  Cheers!

I used to be in love with spinnerbaits and their product in particular. They made different weighted lures and had some large 1 ounce spinners and small bass spinners. I see they don't make them anymore. I'm down to my last small spinner.  Liked their inline spinners too.
T1's aint to bad the only problem i had with them is the paint chips off easy, just give them a coat of nail polish hardner to prolong the paint from chipping off.

T2's are great spinnerbaits, especially at that price! They use slightly cheaper components on the T2's, but they still catch fish, and they still stand up to abuse better than a steel-frame spinnerbait.
